data.title: Ha Dong-kyun
data.snippet: Ha Dong-kyun (Korean: 하동균; born June 28, 1980), professionally known as Ha Dong Qn, is a South Korean singer-songwriter recognized for his distinctive husky voice and emotive power ballads. Active in the K-pop industry for over two decades, he has built a career spanning group performances, solo releases, and television appearances, earning acclaim for his vocal depth and songwriting. Ha began his music career in 2002 as a member of the short-lived boy band 7Dayz, which disbanded shortly after debut. In 2004, he joined the YG Entertainment group Wanted, releasing their debut album before the group entered a three-year hiatus following the tragic death of member Seo Jae-hyo in a car accident. Transitioning to a solo path, Ha released his debut studio album Stand Alone in 2006, followed by [...] Ha Dong-kyun began his radio hosting career with the early morning program Radio Days Ha Dong-kyun desu on MBC FM4U, airing from April 8, 2008, to April 20, 2009, in the 4:00–5:00 a.m. slot. The show featured his signature calm yet occasionally sharp-witted style, fostering a relaxed atmosphere for listeners starting their day. During his tenure, he organized collaborative events like the Inmak Concert alongside DJ Lee So-ra and announcer Mun Ji-ae, inviting musical guests such as Sweet Sorrow and NELL to perform and discuss their work. His final broadcast before military enlistment marked the end of the program. He later took on temporary hosting roles as a special DJ for MBC FM4U's popular late-night program Blue Night. In January 2017, from the 26th to the 30th, Ha filled in following [...] Ha Dong-kyun was born on June 28, 1980, in Jungnang-gu, Seoul, South Korea. Public information about his immediate family is limited, but he was raised by his parents alongside an older sister. This modest family background in a Seoul neighborhood appears to have fostered his relatable and grounded public persona, though specific details on his parents' occupations or home life are not widely documented. From a young age, Ha Dong-kyun showed an affinity for music, particularly rock, which he listened to avidly and even performed as a vocalist in a high school rock band—marking his initial forays into singing without any mention of formal training at that stage. These early local influences in Seoul helped shape his passion for music, setting the foundation for his later career pursuits.

data.title: Dong-Kyun Ha
data.snippet:
Ha Dong-kyun (Korean: 하동균; born June 28, 1980), known professionally as Ha Dong Qn, is a South Korean singer-songwriter known for his deep vocal timbre, wide range, and emotive ballad performances that have established him as a respected vocalist in the Korean music industry.   Born on June 28, 1980, in Seoul, he debuted in 2002 as a member of the short-lived vocal group 7Dayz before joining the boy band Wanted in 2004, where he has continued to perform despite intermittent hiatuses over the years.   His solo career began in 2006 with the release of the single album DQ from WANTED, followed by notable works including the studio albums Stand Alone (2006) and Another Corner (2008), as well as the EPs Mark (2012), Word (2014), and Polygon (2017).  Ha has further broadened his recognition [...] Ha Dong-kyun has frequently appeared as a performer, contestant, or guest on South Korean music competition shows, variety programs, and performance-based television formats, highlighting his vocal prowess and engaging personality.   In 2019, he joined as a regular member of the second lineup for The Call Season 2, a collaborative music variety show that paired artists for performances.  He continued this trend in 2023 by serving as a regular cast member on Begin Again Season 5: Intermission, a program featuring acoustic performances and musical interactions.  More recently, in 2024, Ha Dong-kyun appeared on Song Stealer as a Song Stealer in two episodes and as a performer on SynchroU in one episode.   He has also made guest appearances on long-running talk and music variety shows, [...] ## Early life

### Early years and background

Ha Dong-kyun was born on June 28, 1980, in Seoul, South Korea, specifically in the Jungnang-gu district (formerly part of Dongdaemun-gu).  His zodiac sign is Cancer, and he is Protestant Christian.  Early profiles list his height as 175 cm and blood type as O.  From childhood, Ha Dong-kyun developed a passion for music, particularly rock and heavy metal genres, listening to bands such as Whitesnake and Mr. Big while participating in rock bands during his youth.  These early experiences nurtured his dream of becoming a musician before his professional entry into the industry in 2002. 

## Career

### 2002–2005: Group debut with 7Dayz and Wanted

data.title: Ha Dong-kyun
data.snippet:
Ha Dong-kyun (Korean: 하동균; born June 28, 1980), officially known as Ha Dong Qn, is a South Korean singer-songwriter. He debuted in 2002 as a member of the short-lived boy band 7Dayz, before joining the boy band Wanted "Wanted (South Korean band)") in 2004. As a solo singer, he has released two albums: Stand Alone (2006) and Another Corner (2008), and three extended plays: Mark (2012), Word (2014), and Polygon (2017).

data.title: Ha Dong QN (하동균)
data.snippet:
Ha Dong Gyun, also known as Ha Dong QN, is a South Korean singer-songwriter. He debuted in 2002 as a member of the short-lived boy band 7Dayz, before joining the boy band Wanted in 2004. As a solo singer, he has released two albums: Stand Alone (2006) and Another Corner (2008), and three extended plays: Mark (2012), Word (2014), and Polygon (2017).

|  |

| Dongkyun Ha HA DONG-QN | [...] After the accident, Wanted temporarily suspended its activities, and Ha Dong-gyun took a break from activities again for about two years for rehabilitation reasons. Due to the injuries he sustained at this time, he was diagnosed as a social worker by medical examination. It is said that he went through such a painful time that he decided to quit being a singer due to the sadness and PTSD of losing his close friend at an early age. In a pictorial dated May 26, 2017, he mentioned that he had no memory of this accident for several years. [...] Blue Night Special DJ: Since Blue Night's former DJ, Lee Dong-jin , left, a successor has not been decided, so special DJ's replacement broadcasts continue. After Lee Dong-jin's departure, Ha Dong-gyun took on the role of the second special DJ following MBC announcer Kim Su-ji , who proceeded from September 22 to 24 . In the first room on September 25th, with the opening remarks below, we approached listeners who were deeply hurt after Lee Dong-jin's unexpected departure.

  > There is no better investment than calling your name. So this is Blue Night, and I am Ha Dong-kyun.

data.title: Ha Dong Gyun
data.snippet:
Date of birth : June 28th, 1980  
 Physique : 175cm, 63kg  
 Religion : Christianity  
 Hobbies : Listening to music, driving, computer games  
   
   
  
 Ha Dong Gyun was previously a member of Wanted, a band that debuted in 2004. Thanks to his good looks and deep voice, Ha Dong Gyun has won over many fans even before his official solo debut. The song "Always", used in the OST of a television series, gave Ha instant popularity.   
 Only 2 months after the release of its album, Wanted held a sold-out concert for 1000 fans. On the way home from the concert, an unfortunate traffic accident took away the life of one of the band members and caused injury to the rest of the members. Two years since the accident, Ha has returned to the local music scene with a solo album. [...] Menu Content
